Math.Description: Some simple math problems. Number of questions: 5
Math.Q4: When can Green's Theorem be used?
Math.A1: When the curve is does not enclose an area
Math.A2: When the curve is a negatively-oriented, simple closed curve
Math.A3: When the curve is a positively-oriented, simple closed curve
Math.A4: It can be used on any curve
Math.Q5: What is the output of curl(F), where F is a vector field?

Physics.Description: Some stupid difficult physics problems. Number of questions: 5
Physics.Q1: Which of the following is a physical quantity that has a magnitude but no direction?
Physics.Q2: Which of the following is a physical quantity that has both magnitude and direction?
Physics.Q3: In a coordinate system, a vector is oriented at angle with respect to the x-axis. The y component of the vector equals the vector's magnitude multiplied by which trigonometric function?
Physics.Q4: Which of the following is the motion of objects moving in two dimensions under the influence of gravity?
Physics.Q5: What is the path of a projectile (in the absence of friction)?
Physics.A2: Projectiles do not follow a predictable path

Marvel.Description: Trivia about your favorite Marvel super heroes. Number of questions: 5
Marvel.Q1: What was Wolverine's name when he was a Horseman of the Apocalypse?
Marvel.Q2: What is the Avengers' primary mode of transport?
Marvel.Q3: Who has not been a member of the Avengers?
Marvel.Q4: Wolverine is often called Logan, but what is his actual birth name?
